intro: Anisadenia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy anisadenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves that are often glandular. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in subtropical gardens.
